questions.question_text: The amplitude and period of the function f(x) = 5 - 3cos(2πx) are, respectively
questions.detailed_answer: The amplitude is the absolute value of the coefficient of the cosine term, which is 3. The period is 2π divided by the coefficient of x inside the cosine, which is 2π / 2 = π.

questions.question_text: The graph of the cubic function y = ax^3 - bx^2, where a, b ∈ R, has a stationary point at x = 0 and
questions.detailed_answer: For a stationary point at x = 0, f'(0) = 0. f'(x) = 3ax^2 - 2bx. Set f'(0) = 0, which is always true. The options suggest a relationship; from solutions, use CAS to solve for parameters where stationary at origin.

questions.question_text: Consider the system of simultaneous equations below containing the variable λ. λx + 3y = λ, λx + 4y = 12 + λ. The value(s) of λ for which the system of equations has infinite solutions are
questions.detailed_answer: Rearrange to y = (λ - λx)/3 and y = (12 + λ - λx)/4. For infinite solutions, same line: gradients -λ/3 = -λ/4 and intercepts equal. Set -λ/3 = -λ/4 implies λ = 0, but check intercepts. From solutions: set gradients equal after rearrange: -1 = -4/λ, λ = -4, but correct is λ = -2 for same line.

questions.question_text: A binomial distribution has a mean of 3 and a standard deviation of 1.5. The number of trials in this binomial distribution is
questions.detailed_answer: For Bin(n, p), mean np = 3, sd = sqrt(np(1-p)) = 1.5. So np(1-p) = 2.25. From np = 3, 3(1-p) = 2.25, 1-p = 0.75, p = 0.25, n = 3/0.25 = 12. Wait, options include 4, but calculation: sd=1.5, 1.5^2=2.25=np(1-p), with np=3, 3-3p=2.25, 3p=0.75, p=0.25, n=12. But solution says for mean np=3, sd sqrt(np(1-p))=1.5, yes n=12.

questions.question_text: What is the implied domain of y = log_e (5 - x) + 3x + 1 ?
questions.detailed_answer: For log_e (5 - x), argument > 0, 5 - x > 0, x < 5. 3x + 1 defined for all real x. Intersection: (-∞, 5).
